00025 /*
00026  * lustre/osp/osp_trans.c
00027  *
00028  *
00029  * 1. OSP (Object Storage Proxy) transaction methods
00030  *
00031  * Implement OSP layer transaction related interfaces for the dt_device API
00032  * dt_device_operations.
00033  *
00034  *
00035  * 2. Handle asynchronous idempotent operations
00036  *
00037  * The OSP uses OUT (Object Unified Target) RPC to talk with other server
00038  * (MDT or OST) for kinds of operations, such as create, unlink, insert,
00039  * delete, lookup, set_(x)attr, get_(x)attr, and etc. To reduce the number
00040  * of RPCs, we allow multiple operations to be packaged together in single
00041  * OUT RPC.
00042  *
00043  * For the asynchronous idempotent operations, such as get_(x)attr, related
00044  * RPCs will be inserted into an osp_device based shared asynchronous request
00045  * queue - osp_device::opd_async_requests. When the queue is full, all the
00046  * requests in the queue will be packaged into a single OUT RPC and given to
00047  * the ptlrpcd daemon (for sending), then the queue is purged and other new
00048  * requests can be inserted into it.
00049  *
00050  * When the asynchronous idempotent operation inserts the request into the
00051  * shared queue, it will register an interpreter. When the packaged OUT RPC
00052  * is replied (or failed to be sent out), all the registered interpreters
00053  * will be called one by one to handle each own result.
00054  *
00055  *
00056  * There are three kinds of transactions
00057  *
00058  * 1. Local transaction, all of updates of the transaction are in the local MDT.
00059  * 2. Remote transaction, all of updates of the transaction are in one remote
00060  * MDT, which only happens in LFSCK now.
00061  * 3. Distribute transaction, updates for the transaction are in mulitple MDTs.
00062  *
00063  * Author: Di Wang <di.wang@intel.com>
00064  * Author: Fan, Yong <fan.yong@intel.com>
00065  */
00066 
00067 #define DEBUG_SUBSYSTEM S_MDS
00068 
00069 #include <lustre_net.h>
00070 #include "osp_internal.h"

00075 struct osp_update_args {
00076         struct osp_update_request *oaua_update;
00077         atomic_t                 *oaua_count;
00078         wait_queue_head_t        *oaua_waitq;
00079         bool                      oaua_flow_control;
00080         const struct lu_env      *oaua_update_env;
00081 };
00082 
00086 struct osp_update_callback {
00087         /* list in the osp_update_request::our_cb_items */
00088         struct list_head                 ouc_list;
00089 
00090         /* The target of the async update request. */
00091         struct osp_object               *ouc_obj;
00092 
00093         /* The data used by or_interpreter. */
00094         void                            *ouc_data;
00095 
00096         /* The interpreter function called after the async request handled. */
00097         osp_update_interpreter_t        ouc_interpreter;
00098 };
00099 
00100 static struct object_update_request *object_update_request_alloc(size_t size)
00101 {
00102         struct object_update_request *ourq;
00103 
00104         OBD_ALLOC_LARGE(ourq, size);
00105         if (ourq == NULL)
00106                 return ERR_PTR(-ENOMEM);
00107 
00108         ourq->ourq_magic = UPDATE_REQUEST_MAGIC;
00109         ourq->ourq_count = 0;
00110 
00111         return ourq;
00112 }
00113 
00125 int osp_object_update_request_create(struct osp_update_request *our,
00126                                      size_t size)
00127 {
00128         struct osp_update_request_sub *ours;
00129 
00130         OBD_ALLOC_PTR(ours);
00131         if (ours == NULL)
00132                 return -ENOMEM;
00133 
00134         if (size < OUT_UPDATE_INIT_BUFFER_SIZE)
00135                 size = OUT_UPDATE_INIT_BUFFER_SIZE;
00136 
00137         ours->ours_req = object_update_request_alloc(size);
00138 
00139         if (IS_ERR(ours->ours_req)) {
00140                 OBD_FREE_PTR(ours);
00141                 return -ENOMEM;
00142         }
00143 
00144         ours->ours_req_size = size;
00145         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&ours->ours_list);
00146         list_add_tail(&ours->ours_list, &our->our_req_list);
00147         our->our_req_nr++;
00148 
00149         return 0;
00150 }
00151 
00165 struct osp_update_request_sub *
00166 osp_current_object_update_request(struct osp_update_request *our)
00167 {
00168         if (list_empty(&our->our_req_list))
00169                 return NULL;
00170 
00171         return list_entry(our->our_req_list.prev, struct osp_update_request_sub,
00172                           ours_list);
00173 }
00174 
00187 struct osp_update_request *osp_update_request_create(struct dt_device *dt)
00188 {
00189         struct osp_update_request *our;
00190 
00191         OBD_ALLOC_PTR(our);
00192         if (our == NULL)
00193                 return ERR_PTR(-ENOMEM);
00194 
00195         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&our->our_req_list);
00196         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&our->our_cb_items);
00197         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&our->our_list);
00198         spin_lock_init(&our->our_list_lock);
00199 
00200         osp_object_update_request_create(our, OUT_UPDATE_INIT_BUFFER_SIZE);
00201         return our;
00202 }
00203 
00204 void osp_update_request_destroy(struct osp_update_request *our)
00205 {
00206         struct osp_update_request_sub *ours;
00207         struct osp_update_request_sub *tmp;
00208 
00209         if (our == NULL)
00210                 return;
00211 
00212         list_for_each_entry_safe(ours, tmp, &our->our_req_list, ours_list) {
00213                 list_del(&ours->ours_list);
00214                 if (ours->ours_req != NULL)
00215                         OBD_FREE_LARGE(ours->ours_req, ours->ours_req_size);
00216                 OBD_FREE_PTR(ours);
00217         }
00218         OBD_FREE_PTR(our);
00219 }
00220 
00221 static void
00222 object_update_request_dump(const struct object_update_request *ourq,
00223                            unsigned int mask)
00224 {
00225         unsigned int i;
00226         size_t total_size = 0;
00227 
00228         for (i = 0; i < ourq->ourq_count; i++) {
00229                 struct object_update    *update;
00230                 size_t                  size = 0;
00231 
00232                 update = object_update_request_get(ourq, i, &size);
00233                 LASSERT(update != NULL);
00234                 CDEBUG(mask, "i = %u fid = "DFID" op = %s "
00235                        "params = %d batchid = "LPU64" size = %zu repsize %u\n",
00236                        i, PFID(&update->ou_fid),
00237                        update_op_str(update->ou_type),
00238                        update->ou_params_count,
00239                        update->ou_batchid, size,
00240                        (unsigned)update->ou_result_size);
00241 
00242                 total_size += size;
00243         }
00244 
00245         CDEBUG(mask, "updates = %p magic = %x count = %d size = %zu\n", ourq,
00246                ourq->ourq_magic, ourq->ourq_count, total_size);
00247 }
00248 
00262 int osp_prep_inline_update_req(const struct lu_env *env,
00263                                struct ptlrpc_request *req,
00264                                struct osp_update_request *our,
00265                                int repsize)
00266 {
00267         struct osp_update_request_sub *ours;
00268         struct out_update_header *ouh;
00269         __u32 update_req_size;
00270         int rc;
00271 
00272         ours = list_entry(our->our_req_list.next,
00273                           struct osp_update_request_sub, ours_list);
00274         update_req_size = object_update_request_size(ours->ours_req);
00275         req_capsule_set_size(&req->rq_pill, &RMF_OUT_UPDATE_HEADER, RCL_CLIENT,
00276                              update_req_size + sizeof(*ouh));
00277 
00278         rc = ptlrpc_request_pack(req, LUSTRE_MDS_VERSION, OUT_UPDATE);
00279         if (rc != 0)
00280                 RETURN(rc);
00281 
00282         ouh = req_capsule_client_get(&req->rq_pill, &RMF_OUT_UPDATE_HEADER);
00283         ouh->ouh_magic = OUT_UPDATE_HEADER_MAGIC;
00284         ouh->ouh_count = 1;
00285         ouh->ouh_inline_length = update_req_size;
00286         ouh->ouh_reply_size = repsize;
00287 
00288         memcpy(ouh->ouh_inline_data, ours->ours_req, update_req_size);
00289 
00290         req_capsule_set_size(&req->rq_pill, &RMF_OUT_UPDATE_REPLY,
00291                              RCL_SERVER, repsize);
00292 
00293         ptlrpc_request_set_replen(req);
00294         req->rq_request_portal = OUT_PORTAL;
00295         req->rq_reply_portal = OSC_REPLY_PORTAL;
00296 
00297         RETURN(rc);
00298 }
00299 
00314 int osp_prep_update_req(const struct lu_env *env, struct obd_import *imp,
00315                         struct osp_update_request *our,
00316                         struct ptlrpc_request **reqp)
00317 {
00318         struct ptlrpc_request           *req;
00319         struct ptlrpc_bulk_desc         *desc;
00320         struct osp_update_request_sub   *ours;
00321         const struct object_update_request *ourq;
00322         struct out_update_header        *ouh;
00323         struct out_update_buffer        *oub;
00324         __u32                           buf_count = 0;
00325         int                             repsize = 0;
00326         struct object_update_reply      *reply;
00327         int                             rc, i;
00328         int                             total = 0;
00329         ENTRY;
00330 
00331         list_for_each_entry(ours, &our->our_req_list, ours_list) {
00332                 object_update_request_dump(ours->ours_req, D_INFO);
00333 
00334                 ourq = ours->ours_req;
00335                 for (i = 0; i < ourq->ourq_count; i++) {
00336                         struct object_update    *update;
00337                         size_t                  size = 0;
00338 
00339 
00340                         /* XXX: it's very inefficient to lookup update
00341                          *      this way, iterating from the beginning
00342                          *      each time */
00343                         update = object_update_request_get(ourq, i, &size);
00344                         LASSERT(update != NULL);
00345 
00346                         repsize += sizeof(reply->ourp_lens[0]);
00347                         repsize += sizeof(struct object_update_result);
00348                         repsize += update->ou_result_size;
00349                 }
00350 
00351                 buf_count++;
00352         }
00353         repsize += sizeof(*reply);
00354         repsize = (repsize + OUT_UPDATE_REPLY_SIZE - 1) &
00355                         ~(OUT_UPDATE_REPLY_SIZE - 1);
00356         LASSERT(buf_count > 0);
00357 
00358         req = ptlrpc_request_alloc(imp, &RQF_OUT_UPDATE);
00359         if (req == NULL)
00360                 RETURN(-ENOMEM);
00361 
00362         if (buf_count == 1) {
00363                 ours = list_entry(our->our_req_list.next,
00364                                   struct osp_update_request_sub, ours_list);
00365 
00366                 /* Let's check if it can be packed inline */
00367                 if (object_update_request_size(ours->ours_req) +
00368                     sizeof(struct out_update_header) <
00369                                 OUT_UPDATE_MAX_INLINE_SIZE) {
00370                         rc = osp_prep_inline_update_req(env, req, our, repsize);
00371                         if (rc == 0)
00372                                 *reqp = req;
00373                         GOTO(out_req, rc);
00374                 }
00375         }
00376 
00377         req_capsule_set_size(&req->rq_pill, &RMF_OUT_UPDATE_HEADER, RCL_CLIENT,
00378                              sizeof(struct osp_update_request));
00379 
00380         req_capsule_set_size(&req->rq_pill, &RMF_OUT_UPDATE_BUF, RCL_CLIENT,
00381                              buf_count * sizeof(*oub));
00382 
00383         rc = ptlrpc_request_pack(req, LUSTRE_MDS_VERSION, OUT_UPDATE);
00384         if (rc != 0)
00385                 GOTO(out_req, rc);
00386 
00387         ouh = req_capsule_client_get(&req->rq_pill, &RMF_OUT_UPDATE_HEADER);
00388         ouh->ouh_magic = OUT_UPDATE_HEADER_MAGIC;
00389         ouh->ouh_count = buf_count;
00390         ouh->ouh_inline_length = 0;
00391         ouh->ouh_reply_size = repsize;
00392         oub = req_capsule_client_get(&req->rq_pill, &RMF_OUT_UPDATE_BUF);
00393         list_for_each_entry(ours, &our->our_req_list, ours_list) {
00394                 oub->oub_size = ours->ours_req_size;
00395                 oub++;
00396         }
00397 
00398         req->rq_bulk_write = 1;
00399         desc = ptlrpc_prep_bulk_imp(req, buf_count,
00400                 MD_MAX_BRW_SIZE >> LNET_MTU_BITS,
00401                 PTLRPC_BULK_GET_SOURCE | PTLRPC_BULK_BUF_KVEC,
00402                 MDS_BULK_PORTAL, &ptlrpc_bulk_kvec_ops);
00403         if (desc == NULL)
00404                 GOTO(out_req, rc = -ENOMEM);
00405 
00406         /* NB req now owns desc and will free it when it gets freed */
00407         list_for_each_entry(ours, &our->our_req_list, ours_list) {
00408                 desc->bd_frag_ops->add_iov_frag(desc, ours->ours_req,
00409                                                 ours->ours_req_size);
00410                 total += ours->ours_req_size;
00411         }
00412         CDEBUG(D_OTHER, "total %d in %u\n", total, our->our_update_nr);
00413 
00414         req_capsule_set_size(&req->rq_pill, &RMF_OUT_UPDATE_REPLY,
00415                              RCL_SERVER, repsize);
00416 
00417         ptlrpc_request_set_replen(req);
00418         req->rq_request_portal = OUT_PORTAL;
00419         req->rq_reply_portal = OSC_REPLY_PORTAL;
00420         *reqp = req;
00421 
00422 out_req:
00423         if (rc < 0)
00424                 ptlrpc_req_finished(req);
00425 
00426         RETURN(rc);
00427 }
00428 
00442 int osp_remote_sync(const struct lu_env *env, struct osp_device *osp,
00443                     struct osp_update_request *our,
00444                     struct ptlrpc_request **reqp)
00445 {
00446         struct obd_import       *imp = osp->opd_obd->u.cli.cl_import;
00447         struct ptlrpc_request   *req = NULL;
00448         int                     rc;
00449         ENTRY;
00450 
00451         rc = osp_prep_update_req(env, imp, our, &req);
00452         if (rc != 0)
00453                 RETURN(rc);
00454 
00455         /* This will only be called with read-only update, and these updates
00456          * might be used to retrieve update log during recovery process, so
00457          * it will be allowed to send during recovery process */
00458         req->rq_allow_replay = 1;
00459         req->rq_allow_intr = 1;
00460 
00461         /* Note: some dt index api might return non-zero result here, like
00462          * osd_index_ea_lookup, so we should only check rc < 0 here */
00463         rc = ptlrpc_queue_wait(req);
00464         our->our_rc = rc;
00465         if (rc < 0 || reqp == NULL)
00466                 ptlrpc_req_finished(req);
00467         else
00468                 *reqp = req;
00469 
00470         RETURN(rc);
00471 }
00472 
00481 static void osp_thandle_invalidate_object(const struct lu_env *env,
00482                                           struct osp_thandle *oth)
00483 {
00484         struct osp_update_request *our = oth->ot_our;
00485         struct osp_update_request_sub *ours;
00486 
00487         if (our == NULL)
00488                 return;
00489 
00490         list_for_each_entry(ours, &our->our_req_list, ours_list) {
00491                 struct object_update_request *our_req = ours->ours_req;
00492                 unsigned int i;
00493                 struct lu_object *obj;
00494                 struct osp_object *osp_obj;
00495 
00496                 for (i = 0; i < our_req->ourq_count; i++) {
00497                         struct object_update *update;
00498 
00499                         update = object_update_request_get(our_req, i, NULL);
00500                         if (update == NULL)
00501                                 break;
00502 
00503                         if (update->ou_type != OUT_WRITE)
00504                                 continue;
00505 
00506                         if (!fid_is_sane(&update->ou_fid))
00507                                 continue;
00508 
00509                         obj = lu_object_find_slice(env,
00510                                         &oth->ot_super.th_dev->dd_lu_dev,
00511                                         &update->ou_fid, NULL);
00512                         if (IS_ERR(obj))
00513                                 break;
00514 
00515                         osp_obj = lu2osp_obj(obj);
00516                         if (osp_obj->opo_ooa != NULL) {
00517                                 spin_lock(&osp_obj->opo_lock);
00518                                 osp_obj->opo_ooa->ooa_attr.la_valid = 0;
00519                                 osp_obj->opo_stale = 1;
00520                                 spin_unlock(&osp_obj->opo_lock);
00521                         }
00522                         lu_object_put(env, obj);
00523                 }
00524         }
00525 }
00526 
00527 static void osp_trans_stop_cb(const struct lu_env *env,
00528                               struct osp_thandle *oth, int result)
00529 {
00530         struct dt_txn_commit_cb *dcb;
00531         struct dt_txn_commit_cb *tmp;
00532 
00533         /* call per-transaction stop callbacks if any */
00534         list_for_each_entry_safe(dcb, tmp, &oth->ot_stop_dcb_list,
00535                                  dcb_linkage) {
00536                 LASSERTF(dcb->dcb_magic == TRANS_COMMIT_CB_MAGIC,
00537                          "commit callback entry: magic=%x name='%s'\n",
00538                          dcb->dcb_magic, dcb->dcb_name);
00539                 list_del_init(&dcb->dcb_linkage);
00540                 dcb->dcb_func(NULL, &oth->ot_super, dcb, result);
00541         }
00542 
00543         if (result < 0)
00544                 osp_thandle_invalidate_object(env, oth);
00545 }
00546 
00557 static struct osp_update_callback *
00558 osp_update_callback_init(struct osp_object *obj, void *data,
00559                          osp_update_interpreter_t interpreter)
00560 {
00561         struct osp_update_callback *ouc;
00562 
00563         OBD_ALLOC_PTR(ouc);
00564         if (ouc == NULL)
00565                 return NULL;
00566 
00567         lu_object_get(osp2lu_obj(obj));
00568         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&ouc->ouc_list);
00569         ouc->ouc_obj = obj;
00570         ouc->ouc_data = data;
00571         ouc->ouc_interpreter = interpreter;
00572 
00573         return ouc;
00574 }
00575 
00582 static void osp_update_callback_fini(const struct lu_env *env,
00583                                      struct osp_update_callback *ouc)
00584 {
00585         LASSERT(list_empty(&ouc->ouc_list));
00586 
00587         lu_object_put(env, osp2lu_obj(ouc->ouc_obj));
00588         OBD_FREE_PTR(ouc);
00589 }
00590 
00605 static int osp_update_interpret(const struct lu_env *env,
00606                                 struct ptlrpc_request *req, void *arg, int rc)
00607 {
00608         struct object_update_reply      *reply  = NULL;
00609         struct osp_update_args          *oaua   = arg;
00610         struct osp_update_request       *our = oaua->oaua_update;
00611         struct osp_thandle              *oth;
00612         struct osp_update_callback      *ouc;
00613         struct osp_update_callback      *next;
00614         int                              count  = 0;
00615         int                              index  = 0;
00616         int                              rc1    = 0;
00617 
00618         ENTRY;
00619 
00620         if (our == NULL)
00621                 RETURN(0);
00622 
00623         /* Sigh env might be NULL in some cases, see
00624          * this calling path.
00625          * osp_send_update_thread()
00626          *  ptlrpc_set_wait() ----> null env.
00627          *   ptlrpc_check_set()
00628          *    osp_update_interpret()
00629          * Let's use env in oaua for this case.
00630          */
00631         if (env == NULL)
00632                 env = oaua->oaua_update_env;
00633 
00634         oaua->oaua_update = NULL;
00635         oth = our->our_th;
00636         if (oaua->oaua_flow_control) {
00637                 struct osp_device *osp;
00638 
00639                 LASSERT(oth != NULL);
00640                 osp = dt2osp_dev(oth->ot_super.th_dev);
00641                 obd_put_request_slot(&osp->opd_obd->u.cli);
00642         }
00643 
00644         /* Unpack the results from the reply message. */
00645         if (req->rq_repmsg != NULL && req->rq_replied) {
00646                 reply = req_capsule_server_sized_get(&req->rq_pill,
00647                                                      &RMF_OUT_UPDATE_REPLY,
00648                                                      OUT_UPDATE_REPLY_SIZE);
00649                 if (reply == NULL || reply->ourp_magic != UPDATE_REPLY_MAGIC) {
00650                         if (rc == 0)
00651                                 rc = -EPROTO;
00652                 } else {
00653                         count = reply->ourp_count;
00654                 }
00655         }
00656 
00657         list_for_each_entry_safe(ouc, next, &our->our_cb_items, ouc_list) {
00658                 list_del_init(&ouc->ouc_list);
00659 
00660                 /* The peer may only have handled some requests (indicated
00661                  * by the 'count') in the packaged OUT RPC, we can only get
00662                  * results for the handled part. */
00663                 if (index < count && reply->ourp_lens[index] > 0 && rc >= 0) {
00664                         struct object_update_result *result;
00665 
00666                         result = object_update_result_get(reply, index, NULL);
00667                         if (result == NULL)
00668                                 rc1 = rc = -EPROTO;
00669                         else
00670                                 rc1 = rc = result->our_rc;
00671                 } else if (rc1 >= 0) {
00672                         /* The peer did not handle these request, let's return
00673                          * -EINVAL to update interpret for now */
00674                         if (rc >= 0)
00675                                 rc1 = -EINVAL;
00676                         else
00677                                 rc1 = rc;
00678                 }
00679 
00680                 if (ouc->ouc_interpreter != NULL)
00681                         ouc->ouc_interpreter(env, reply, req, ouc->ouc_obj,
00682                                              ouc->ouc_data, index, rc1);
00683 
00684                 osp_update_callback_fini(env, ouc);
00685                 index++;
00686         }
00687 
00688         if (oaua->oaua_count != NULL && atomic_dec_and_test(oaua->oaua_count))
00689                 wake_up_all(oaua->oaua_waitq);
00690 
00691         if (oth != NULL) {
00692                 /* oth and osp_update_requests will be destoryed in
00693                  * osp_thandle_put */
00694                 osp_trans_stop_cb(env, oth, rc);
00695                 osp_thandle_put(oth);
00696         } else {
00697                 osp_update_request_destroy(our);
00698         }
00699 
00700         RETURN(rc);
00701 }
00702 
00714 int osp_unplug_async_request(const struct lu_env *env,
00715                              struct osp_device *osp,
00716                              struct osp_update_request *our)
00717 {
00718         struct osp_update_args  *args;
00719         struct ptlrpc_request   *req = NULL;
00720         int                      rc;
00721 
00722         rc = osp_prep_update_req(env, osp->opd_obd->u.cli.cl_import,
00723                                  our, &req);
00724         if (rc != 0) {
00725                 struct osp_update_callback *ouc;
00726                 struct osp_update_callback *next;
00727 
00728                 list_for_each_entry_safe(ouc, next,
00729                                          &our->our_cb_items, ouc_list) {
00730                         list_del_init(&ouc->ouc_list);
00731                         if (ouc->ouc_interpreter != NULL)
00732                                 ouc->ouc_interpreter(env, NULL, NULL,
00733                                                      ouc->ouc_obj,
00734                                                      ouc->ouc_data, 0, rc);
00735                         osp_update_callback_fini(env, ouc);
00736                 }
00737                 osp_update_request_destroy(our);
00738         } else {
00739                 args = ptlrpc_req_async_args(req);
00740                 args->oaua_update = our;
00741                 args->oaua_count = NULL;
00742                 args->oaua_waitq = NULL;
00743                 /* Note: this is asynchronous call for the request, so the
00744                  * interrupte cb and current function will be different
00745                  * thread, so we need use different env */
00746                 args->oaua_update_env = NULL;
00747                 args->oaua_flow_control = false;
00748                 req->rq_interpret_reply = osp_update_interpret;
00749                 ptlrpcd_add_req(req);
00750         }
00751 
00752         return rc;
00753 }
00754 
00767 static struct osp_update_request *
00768 osp_find_or_create_async_update_request(struct osp_device *osp)
00769 {
00770         struct osp_update_request *our = osp->opd_async_requests;
00771 
00772         if (our != NULL)
00773                 return our;
00774 
00775         our = osp_update_request_create(&osp->opd_dt_dev);
00776         if (IS_ERR(our))
00777                 return our;
00778 
00779         osp->opd_async_requests = our;
00780 
00781         return our;
00782 }
00783 
00799 int osp_insert_update_callback(const struct lu_env *env,
00800                                struct osp_update_request *our,
00801                                struct osp_object *obj, void *data,
00802                                osp_update_interpreter_t interpreter)
00803 {
00804         struct osp_update_callback  *ouc;
00805 
00806         ouc = osp_update_callback_init(obj, data, interpreter);
00807         if (ouc == NULL)
00808                 RETURN(-ENOMEM);
00809 
00810         list_add_tail(&ouc->ouc_list, &our->our_cb_items);
00811 
00812         return 0;
00813 }
00814 
00840 int osp_insert_async_request(const struct lu_env *env, enum update_type op,
00841                              struct osp_object *obj, int count,
00842                              __u16 *lens, const void **bufs,
00843                              void *data, __u32 repsize,
00844                              osp_update_interpreter_t interpreter)
00845 {
00846         struct osp_device               *osp;
00847         struct osp_update_request       *our;
00848         struct object_update            *object_update;
00849         size_t                          max_update_size;
00850         struct object_update_request    *ureq;
00851         struct osp_update_request_sub   *ours;
00852         int                             rc = 0;
00853         ENTRY;
00854 
00855         osp = lu2osp_dev(osp2lu_obj(obj)->lo_dev);
00856         our = osp_find_or_create_async_update_request(osp);
00857         if (IS_ERR(our))
00858                 RETURN(PTR_ERR(our));
00859 
00860 again:
00861         ours = osp_current_object_update_request(our);
00862 
00863         ureq = ours->ours_req;
00864         max_update_size = ours->ours_req_size -
00865                           object_update_request_size(ureq);
00866 
00867         object_update = update_buffer_get_update(ureq, ureq->ourq_count);
00868         rc = out_update_pack(env, object_update, &max_update_size, op,
00869                              lu_object_fid(osp2lu_obj(obj)), count, lens, bufs,
00870                              repsize);
00871         /* The queue is full. */
00872         if (rc == -E2BIG) {
00873                 osp->opd_async_requests = NULL;
00874                 mutex_unlock(&osp->opd_async_requests_mutex);
00875 
00876                 rc = osp_unplug_async_request(env, osp, our);
00877                 mutex_lock(&osp->opd_async_requests_mutex);
00878                 if (rc != 0)
00879                         RETURN(rc);
00880 
00881                 our = osp_find_or_create_async_update_request(osp);
00882                 if (IS_ERR(our))
00883                         RETURN(PTR_ERR(our));
00884 
00885                 goto again;
00886         } else {
00887                 if (rc < 0)
00888                         RETURN(rc);
00889 
00890                 ureq->ourq_count++;
00891                 our->our_update_nr++;
00892         }
00893 
00894         rc = osp_insert_update_callback(env, our, obj, data, interpreter);
00895 
00896         RETURN(rc);
00897 }
00898 
00899 int osp_trans_update_request_create(struct thandle *th)
00900 {
00901         struct osp_thandle              *oth = thandle_to_osp_thandle(th);
00902         struct osp_update_request       *our;
00903 
00904         if (oth->ot_our != NULL)
00905                 return 0;
00906 
00907         our = osp_update_request_create(th->th_dev);
00908         if (IS_ERR(our)) {
00909                 th->th_result = PTR_ERR(our);
00910                 return PTR_ERR(our);
00911         }
00912 
00913         oth->ot_our = our;
00914         our->our_th = oth;
00915 
00916         return 0;
00917 }
00918 
00919 void osp_thandle_destroy(struct osp_thandle *oth)
00920 {
00921         LASSERT(oth->ot_magic == OSP_THANDLE_MAGIC);
00922         LASSERT(list_empty(&oth->ot_commit_dcb_list));
00923         LASSERT(list_empty(&oth->ot_stop_dcb_list));
00924         if (oth->ot_our != NULL)
00925                 osp_update_request_destroy(oth->ot_our);
00926         OBD_FREE_PTR(oth);
00927 }
00928 
00956 struct thandle *osp_trans_create(const struct lu_env *env, struct dt_device *d)
00957 {
00958         struct osp_thandle              *oth;
00959         struct thandle                  *th = NULL;
00960         ENTRY;
00961 
00962         OBD_ALLOC_PTR(oth);
00963         if (unlikely(oth == NULL))
00964                 RETURN(ERR_PTR(-ENOMEM));
00965 
00966         oth->ot_magic = OSP_THANDLE_MAGIC;
00967         th = &oth->ot_super;
00968         th->th_dev = d;
00969         th->th_tags = LCT_TX_HANDLE;
00970 
00971         atomic_set(&oth->ot_refcount, 1);
00972         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&oth->ot_commit_dcb_list);
00973         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&oth->ot_stop_dcb_list);
00974 
00975         RETURN(th);
00976 }
00977 
00989 int osp_trans_cb_add(struct thandle *th, struct dt_txn_commit_cb *dcb)
00990 {
00991         struct osp_thandle *oth = thandle_to_osp_thandle(th);
00992 
00993         LASSERT(dcb->dcb_magic == TRANS_COMMIT_CB_MAGIC);
00994         LASSERT(&dcb->dcb_func != NULL);
00995         if (dcb->dcb_flags & DCB_TRANS_STOP)
00996                 list_add(&dcb->dcb_linkage, &oth->ot_stop_dcb_list);
00997         else
00998                 list_add(&dcb->dcb_linkage, &oth->ot_commit_dcb_list);
00999         return 0;
01000 }
01001 
01002 static void osp_trans_commit_cb(struct osp_thandle *oth, int result)
01003 {
01004         struct dt_txn_commit_cb *dcb;
01005         struct dt_txn_commit_cb *tmp;
01006 
01007         LASSERT(atomic_read(&oth->ot_refcount) > 0);
01008         /* call per-transaction callbacks if any */
01009         list_for_each_entry_safe(dcb, tmp, &oth->ot_commit_dcb_list,
01010                                  dcb_linkage) {
01011                 LASSERTF(dcb->dcb_magic == TRANS_COMMIT_CB_MAGIC,
01012                          "commit callback entry: magic=%x name='%s'\n",
01013                          dcb->dcb_magic, dcb->dcb_name);
01014                 list_del_init(&dcb->dcb_linkage);
01015                 dcb->dcb_func(NULL, &oth->ot_super, dcb, result);
01016         }
01017 }
01018 
01019 static void osp_request_commit_cb(struct ptlrpc_request *req)
01020 {
01021         struct thandle          *th = req->rq_cb_data;
01022         struct osp_thandle      *oth;
01023         __u64                   last_committed_transno = 0;
01024         int                     result = req->rq_status;
01025         ENTRY;
01026 
01027         if (th == NULL)
01028                 RETURN_EXIT;
01029 
01030         oth = thandle_to_osp_thandle(th);
01031         if (req->rq_repmsg != NULL &&
01032             lustre_msg_get_last_committed(req->rq_repmsg))
01033                 last_committed_transno =
01034                         lustre_msg_get_last_committed(req->rq_repmsg);
01035 
01036         if (last_committed_transno <
01037                 req->rq_import->imp_peer_committed_transno)
01038                 last_committed_transno =
01039                         req->rq_import->imp_peer_committed_transno;
01040 
01041         CDEBUG(D_HA, "trans no "LPU64" committed transno "LPU64"\n",
01042                req->rq_transno, last_committed_transno);
01043 
01044         /* If the transaction is not really committed, mark result = 1 */
01045         if (req->rq_transno != 0 &&
01046             (req->rq_transno > last_committed_transno) && result == 0)
01047                 result = 1;
01048 
01049         osp_trans_commit_cb(oth, result);
01050         req->rq_committed = 1;
01051         osp_thandle_put(oth);
01052         EXIT;
01053 }
01054 
01067 void osp_trans_callback(const struct lu_env *env,
01068                         struct osp_thandle *oth, int rc)
01069 {
01070         struct osp_update_callback *ouc;
01071         struct osp_update_callback *next;
01072 
01073         if (oth->ot_our != NULL) {
01074                 list_for_each_entry_safe(ouc, next,
01075                                          &oth->ot_our->our_cb_items, ouc_list) {
01076                         list_del_init(&ouc->ouc_list);
01077                         if (ouc->ouc_interpreter != NULL)
01078                                 ouc->ouc_interpreter(env, NULL, NULL,
01079                                                      ouc->ouc_obj,
01080                                                      ouc->ouc_data, 0, rc);
01081                         osp_update_callback_fini(env, ouc);
01082                 }
01083         }
01084         osp_trans_stop_cb(env, oth, rc);
01085         osp_trans_commit_cb(oth, rc);
01086 }
01087 
01104 static int osp_send_update_req(const struct lu_env *env,
01105                                struct osp_device *osp,
01106                                struct osp_update_request *our)
01107 {
01108         struct osp_update_args  *args;
01109         struct ptlrpc_request   *req;
01110         struct lu_device *top_device;
01111         struct osp_thandle      *oth = our->our_th;
01112         int     rc = 0;
01113         ENTRY;
01114 
01115         LASSERT(oth != NULL);
01116         rc = osp_prep_update_req(env, osp->opd_obd->u.cli.cl_import,
01117                                  our, &req);
01118         if (rc != 0) {
01119                 osp_trans_callback(env, oth, rc);
01120                 RETURN(rc);
01121         }
01122 
01123         args = ptlrpc_req_async_args(req);
01124         args->oaua_update = our;
01125         /* set env to NULL, in case the interrupt cb and current function
01126          * are in different thread */
01127         args->oaua_update_env = NULL;
01128         osp_thandle_get(oth); /* hold for update interpret */
01129         req->rq_interpret_reply = osp_update_interpret;
01130         if (!oth->ot_super.th_wait_submit && !oth->ot_super.th_sync) {
01131                 if (!osp->opd_imp_active || !osp->opd_imp_connected) {
01132                         osp_trans_callback(env, oth, rc);
01133                         osp_thandle_put(oth);
01134                         GOTO(out, rc = -ENOTCONN);
01135                 }
01136 
01137                 rc = obd_get_request_slot(&osp->opd_obd->u.cli);
01138                 if (rc != 0) {
01139                         osp_trans_callback(env, oth, rc);
01140                         osp_thandle_put(oth);
01141                         GOTO(out, rc = -ENOTCONN);
01142                 }
01143                 args->oaua_flow_control = true;
01144 
01145                 if (!osp->opd_connect_mdt) {
01146                         down_read(&osp->opd_async_updates_rwsem);
01147                         args->oaua_count = &osp->opd_async_updates_count;
01148                         args->oaua_waitq = &osp->opd_syn_barrier_waitq;
01149                         up_read(&osp->opd_async_updates_rwsem);
01150                         atomic_inc(args->oaua_count);
01151                 }
01152 
01153                 ptlrpcd_add_req(req);
01154                 req = NULL;
01155         } else {
01156                 osp_thandle_get(oth); /* hold for commit callback */
01157                 req->rq_commit_cb = osp_request_commit_cb;
01158                 req->rq_cb_data = &oth->ot_super;
01159                 args->oaua_flow_control = false;
01160 
01161                 /* If the transaction is created during MDT recoverying
01162                  * process, it means this is an recovery update, we need
01163                  * to let OSP send it anyway without checking recoverying
01164                  * status, in case the other target is being recoveried
01165                  * at the same time, and if we wait here for the import
01166                  * to be recoveryed, it might cause deadlock */
01167                 top_device = osp->opd_dt_dev.dd_lu_dev.ld_site->ls_top_dev;
01168                 if (top_device->ld_obd->obd_recovering)
01169                         req->rq_allow_replay = 1;
01170 
01171                 /* Because this req will be synchronus, i.e. it will be called
01172                  * in the same thread, so it will be safe to use current
01173                  * env */
01174                 args->oaua_update_env = env;
01175                 if (osp->opd_connect_mdt)
01176                         osp_get_rpc_lock(osp);
01177                 rc = ptlrpc_queue_wait(req);
01178                 if (osp->opd_connect_mdt)
01179                         osp_put_rpc_lock(osp);
01180                 if ((rc == -ENOMEM && req->rq_set == NULL) ||
01181                     (req->rq_transno == 0 && !req->rq_committed)) {
01182                         if (args->oaua_update != NULL) {
01183                                 /* If osp_update_interpret is not being called,
01184                                  * release the osp_thandle */
01185                                 args->oaua_update = NULL;
01186                                 osp_thandle_put(oth);
01187                         }
01188 
01189                         req->rq_cb_data = NULL;
01190                         rc = rc == 0 ? req->rq_status : rc;
01191                         osp_trans_callback(env, oth, rc);
01192                         osp_thandle_put(oth);
01193                         GOTO(out, rc);
01194                 }
01195         }
01196 out:
01197         if (req != NULL)
01198                 ptlrpc_req_finished(req);
01199 
01200         RETURN(rc);
01201 }
01202 
01227 struct thandle *osp_get_storage_thandle(const struct lu_env *env,
01228                                         struct thandle *th,
01229                                         struct osp_device *osp)
01230 {
01231         struct osp_thandle      *oth;
01232         struct thandle          *local_th;
01233 
01234         if (th->th_top != NULL)
01235                 return thandle_get_sub_by_dt(env, th->th_top,
01236                                              osp->opd_storage);
01237 
01238         LASSERT(!osp->opd_connect_mdt);
01239         oth = thandle_to_osp_thandle(th);
01240         if (oth->ot_storage_th != NULL)
01241                 return oth->ot_storage_th;
01242 
01243         local_th = dt_trans_create(env, osp->opd_storage);
01244         if (IS_ERR(local_th))
01245                 return local_th;
01246 
01247         oth->ot_storage_th = local_th;
01248 
01249         return local_th;
01250 }
01251 
01264 int osp_check_and_set_rpc_version(struct osp_thandle *oth,
01265                                   struct osp_object *obj)
01266 {
01267         struct osp_device *osp = dt2osp_dev(oth->ot_super.th_dev);
01268         struct osp_updates *ou = osp->opd_update;
01269 
01270         if (ou == NULL)
01271                 return -EIO;
01272 
01273         if (oth->ot_our->our_version != 0)
01274                 return 0;
01275 
01276         spin_lock(&ou->ou_lock);
01277         spin_lock(&oth->ot_our->our_list_lock);
01278         if (obj->opo_stale) {
01279                 spin_unlock(&oth->ot_our->our_list_lock);
01280                 spin_unlock(&ou->ou_lock);
01281                 return -ESTALE;
01282         }
01283 
01284         /* Assign the version and add it to the sending list */
01285         osp_thandle_get(oth);
01286         oth->ot_our->our_version = ou->ou_version++;
01287         list_add_tail(&oth->ot_our->our_list,
01288                       &osp->opd_update->ou_list);
01289         oth->ot_our->our_req_ready = 0;
01290         spin_unlock(&oth->ot_our->our_list_lock);
01291         spin_unlock(&ou->ou_lock);
01292 
01293         LASSERT(oth->ot_super.th_wait_submit == 1);
01294         CDEBUG(D_INFO, "%s: version "LPU64" oth:version %p:"LPU64"\n",
01295                osp->opd_obd->obd_name, ou->ou_version, oth,
01296                oth->ot_our->our_version);
01297 
01298         return 0;
01299 }
01300 
01314 static bool
01315 osp_get_next_request(struct osp_updates *ou, struct osp_update_request **ourp)
01316 {
01317         struct osp_update_request *our;
01318         struct osp_update_request *tmp;
01319         bool                    got_req = false;
01320 
01321         spin_lock(&ou->ou_lock);
01322         list_for_each_entry_safe(our, tmp, &ou->ou_list, our_list) {
01323                 LASSERT(our->our_th != NULL);
01324                 CDEBUG(D_HA, "ou %p version "LPU64" rpc_version "LPU64"\n",
01325                        ou, our->our_version, ou->ou_rpc_version);
01326                 spin_lock(&our->our_list_lock);
01327                 /* Find next osp_update_request in the list */
01328                 if (our->our_version == ou->ou_rpc_version &&
01329                     our->our_req_ready) {
01330                         list_del_init(&our->our_list);
01331                         spin_unlock(&our->our_list_lock);
01332                         *ourp = our;
01333                         got_req = true;
01334                         break;
01335                 }
01336                 spin_unlock(&our->our_list_lock);
01337         }
01338         spin_unlock(&ou->ou_lock);
01339 
01340         return got_req;
01341 }
01342 
01354 void osp_invalidate_request(struct osp_device *osp)
01355 {
01356         struct lu_env env;
01357         struct osp_updates *ou = osp->opd_update;
01358         struct osp_update_request *our;
01359         struct osp_update_request *tmp;
01360         LIST_HEAD(list);
01361         int                     rc;
01362         ENTRY;
01363 
01364         if (ou == NULL)
01365                 return;
01366 
01367         rc = lu_env_init(&env, osp->opd_dt_dev.dd_lu_dev.ld_type->ldt_ctx_tags);
01368         if (rc < 0) {
01369                 CERROR("%s: init env error: rc = %d\n", osp->opd_obd->obd_name,
01370                        rc);
01371                 return;
01372         }
01373 
01374         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&list);
01375 
01376         spin_lock(&ou->ou_lock);
01377         /* invalidate all of request in the sending list */
01378         list_for_each_entry_safe(our, tmp, &ou->ou_list, our_list) {
01379                 spin_lock(&our->our_list_lock);
01380                 if (our->our_req_ready)
01381                         list_move(&our->our_list, &list);
01382                 else
01383                         list_del_init(&our->our_list);
01384 
01385                 if (our->our_th->ot_super.th_result == 0)
01386                         our->our_th->ot_super.th_result = -EIO;
01387 
01388                 if (our->our_version >= ou->ou_rpc_version)
01389                         ou->ou_rpc_version = our->our_version + 1;
01390                 spin_unlock(&our->our_list_lock);
01391 
01392                 CDEBUG(D_HA, "%s invalidate our %p\n", osp->opd_obd->obd_name,
01393                        our);
01394         }
01395 
01396         spin_unlock(&ou->ou_lock);
01397 
01398         /* invalidate all of request in the sending list */
01399         list_for_each_entry_safe(our, tmp, &list, our_list) {
01400                 spin_lock(&our->our_list_lock);
01401                 list_del_init(&our->our_list);
01402                 spin_unlock(&our->our_list_lock);
01403                 osp_trans_callback(&env, our->our_th,
01404                                    our->our_th->ot_super.th_result);
01405                 osp_thandle_put(our->our_th);
01406         }
01407         lu_env_fini(&env);
01408 }
01409 
01423 int osp_send_update_thread(void *arg)
01424 {
01425         struct lu_env           env;
01426         struct osp_device       *osp = arg;
01427         struct l_wait_info       lwi = { 0 };
01428         struct osp_updates      *ou = osp->opd_update;
01429         struct ptlrpc_thread    *thread = &osp->opd_update_thread;
01430         struct osp_update_request *our = NULL;
01431         int                     rc;
01432         ENTRY;
01433 
01434         LASSERT(ou != NULL);
01435         rc = lu_env_init(&env, osp->opd_dt_dev.dd_lu_dev.ld_type->ldt_ctx_tags);
01436         if (rc < 0) {
01437                 CERROR("%s: init env error: rc = %d\n", osp->opd_obd->obd_name,
01438                        rc);
01439                 RETURN(rc);
01440         }
01441 
01442         thread->t_flags = SVC_RUNNING;
01443         wake_up(&thread->t_ctl_waitq);
01444         while (1) {
01445                 our = NULL;
01446                 l_wait_event(ou->ou_waitq,
01447                              !osp_send_update_thread_running(osp) ||
01448                              osp_get_next_request(ou, &our), &lwi);
01449 
01450                 if (!osp_send_update_thread_running(osp)) {
01451                         if (our != NULL) {
01452                                 osp_trans_callback(&env, our->our_th, -EINTR);
01453                                 osp_thandle_put(our->our_th);
01454                         }
01455                         break;
01456                 }
01457 
01458                 LASSERT(our->our_th != NULL);
01459                 if (our->our_th->ot_super.th_result != 0) {
01460                         osp_trans_callback(&env, our->our_th,
01461                                 our->our_th->ot_super.th_result);
01462                         rc = our->our_th->ot_super.th_result;
01463                 } else if (OBD_FAIL_CHECK(OBD_FAIL_INVALIDATE_UPDATE)) {
01464                         rc = -EIO;
01465                         osp_trans_callback(&env, our->our_th, rc);
01466                 } else {
01467                         rc = osp_send_update_req(&env, osp, our);
01468                 }
01469 
01470                 /* Update the rpc version */
01471                 spin_lock(&ou->ou_lock);
01472                 if (our->our_version == ou->ou_rpc_version)
01473                         ou->ou_rpc_version++;
01474                 spin_unlock(&ou->ou_lock);
01475 
01476                 /* If one update request fails, let's fail all of the requests
01477                  * in the sending list, because the request in the sending
01478                  * list are dependent on either other, continue sending these
01479                  * request might cause llog or filesystem corruption */
01480                 if (rc < 0)
01481                         osp_invalidate_request(osp);
01482 
01483                 /* Balanced for thandle_get in osp_check_and_set_rpc_version */
01484                 osp_thandle_put(our->our_th);
01485         }
01486 
01487         thread->t_flags = SVC_STOPPED;
01488         lu_env_fini(&env);
01489         wake_up(&thread->t_ctl_waitq);
01490 
01491         RETURN(0);
01492 }
01493 
01509 int osp_trans_start(const struct lu_env *env, struct dt_device *dt,
01510                     struct thandle *th)
01511 {
01512         struct osp_thandle      *oth = thandle_to_osp_thandle(th);
01513 
01514         if (oth->ot_super.th_sync)
01515                 oth->ot_our->our_flags |= UPDATE_FL_SYNC;
01516         /* For remote thandle, if there are local thandle, start it here*/
01517         if (is_only_remote_trans(th) && oth->ot_storage_th != NULL)
01518                 return dt_trans_start(env, oth->ot_storage_th->th_dev,
01519                                       oth->ot_storage_th);
01520         return 0;
01521 }
01522 
01542 int osp_trans_stop(const struct lu_env *env, struct dt_device *dt,
01543                    struct thandle *th)
01544 {
01545         struct osp_thandle       *oth = thandle_to_osp_thandle(th);
01546         struct osp_update_request *our = oth->ot_our;
01547         struct osp_device        *osp = dt2osp_dev(dt);
01548         int                      rc = 0;
01549         ENTRY;
01550 
01551         /* For remote transaction, if there is local storage thandle,
01552          * stop it first */
01553         if (oth->ot_storage_th != NULL && th->th_top == NULL) {
01554                 dt_trans_stop(env, oth->ot_storage_th->th_dev,
01555                               oth->ot_storage_th);
01556                 oth->ot_storage_th = NULL;
01557         }
01558 
01559         if (our == NULL || list_empty(&our->our_req_list)) {
01560                 osp_trans_callback(env, oth, th->th_result);
01561                 GOTO(out, rc = th->th_result);
01562         }
01563 
01564         if (!osp->opd_connect_mdt) {
01565                 osp_trans_callback(env, oth, th->th_result);
01566                 rc = osp_send_update_req(env, osp, oth->ot_our);
01567                 GOTO(out, rc);
01568         }
01569 
01570         if (osp->opd_update == NULL ||
01571             !osp_send_update_thread_running(osp)) {
01572                 osp_trans_callback(env, oth, -EIO);
01573                 GOTO(out, rc = -EIO);
01574         }
01575 
01576         CDEBUG(D_HA, "%s: add oth %p with version "LPU64"\n",
01577                osp->opd_obd->obd_name, oth, our->our_version);
01578 
01579         LASSERT(our->our_req_ready == 0);
01580         spin_lock(&our->our_list_lock);
01581         if (likely(!list_empty(&our->our_list))) {
01582                 /* notify sending thread */
01583                 our->our_req_ready = 1;
01584                 wake_up(&osp->opd_update->ou_waitq);
01585                 spin_unlock(&our->our_list_lock);
01586         } else if (th->th_result == 0) {
01587                 /* if the request does not needs to be serialized,
01588                  * read-only request etc, let's send it right away */
01589                 spin_unlock(&our->our_list_lock);
01590                 rc = osp_send_update_req(env, osp, our);
01591         } else {
01592                 spin_unlock(&our->our_list_lock);
01593                 osp_trans_callback(env, oth, th->th_result);
01594         }
01595 out:
01596         osp_thandle_put(oth);
01597 
01598         RETURN(rc);
01599 }
